sense.gloss: nori, laver, edible seaweed, usu. Porphyra yezoensis or P. tenera, usu. dried and pressed into sheets
short plants resembling moss (incl. other bryophytes, lichens, very small spermatophytes, etc.)
bryophyte (any of three groups of non-vascular land plants, incl. mosses, hornworts and liverworts)

r_ele.r: てんせきこけをしょうぜず

sense.gloss: a rolling stone gathers no moss
funori, glue plant, marine alga of the genus Gloiopeltis
funori, glue used as sizing for textiles
bryophyte (any of three groups of non-vascular land plants, incl. mosses, hornworts and liverworts)
green laver (Enteromorpha), green dried seaweed, nori
sushi roll (rolled in nori), rolled sushi, norimaki, makizushi
to become covered in moss, to become mossy, to grow over with moss
to become aged, to grow old
a rolling stone gathers no moss
bryophyte (any of three groups of non-vascular land plants, incl. mosses, hornworts and liverworts)
liverworts, hepatics (non-vascular plants of order Marchantiophyta)
Miquel's mazus (species of small flowering plant, Mazus miquelii)

sdata.j: 「↑転↑↓ころ↓がる↑石↑↓いし↓は↑苔↑↓こけ↓をもつけず」はことわざである。
sdata.e: A rolling stone gathers no moss is a proverb.

sdata.j: うちの↑猫↑↓ねこ↓は↑大変↑↓たいへん↓↑海苔↑↓のり↓が↑好↑↓す↓きである。
sdata.e: Our cat is very fond of seaweed.

sdata.j: 「↑転石↑↓てんせき↓↑苔↑↓こけ↓を↑生↑↓しょう↓ぜず」はことわざである。
sdata.e: A rolling stone gathers no moss is a saying.

sdata.j: ↑苔↑↓こけ↓は、↑倒↑↓たお↓れた↑丸太↑↓まるた↓や↑岩↑↓いわ↓の↑上↑↓うえ↓の↑繊細↑↓せんさい↓な↑緑↑↓みどり↓の↑柔↑↓じゅう↓↑毛↑↓もう↓だと↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑心↑↓こころ↓の↑中↑↓なか↓で↑思↑↓おも↓う。
sdata.e: The moss is a delicate green fur on fallen logs and rocks, I say to myself.

sdata.j: ↑転石↑↓てんせき↓↑苔↑↓こけ↓を↑生↑↓しょう↓ぜず。
sdata.e: A rolling stone gathers no moss.

sdata.j: ↑転石↑↓てんせき↓↑苔↑↓こけ↓むさず。
sdata.e: A rolling stone gathers no moss.

sdata.j: ↑転↑↓ころ↓がる↑石↑↓いし↓には↑苔↑↓こけ↓が↑生↑↓は↓えぬ。
sdata.e: A rolling stone gathers no moss.

sdata.j: ↑転↑↓ころ↓がる↑石↑↓いし↓には↑苔↑↓こけ↓がつかない。
sdata.e: A rolling stone gathers no moss.

sdata.j: ↑転↑↓ころ↓がる↑石↑↓いし↓に↑苔↑↓こけ↓むさず。
sdata.e: A rolling stone gathers no moss.

sdata.j: アボカドに↑海苔↑↓のり↓かけて、わさび↑醤油↑↓じょうゆ↓↑付↑↓つ↓けて↑食↑↓た↓べたらおいしんだよ。
sdata.e: Avocado is delicious when you eat it alongside nori and wasabi-joyu.
